sub_topic: Probability of a certain type of environmental event occurring in a region
message_1: In a particular region, the probability of a hurricane occurring in any given year is 0.07. What is the probability of at least one hurricane occurring in the next 5 years?
message_2:
To find the probability of at least one hurricane occurring in the next 5 years, we can first find the probability of no hurricanes occurring in the next 5 years and then subtract that from 1.

The probability of no hurricane occurring in a given year is 1 - 0.07 = 0.93.

The probability of no hurricanes occurring in 5 consecutive years is (0.93)^5.

Now, we can find the probability of at least one hurricane occurring in the next 5 years:

P(at least one hurricane) = 1 - P(no hurricanes)
P(at least one hurricane) = 1 - (0.93)^5

Calculating the value:

P(at least one hurricane) ≈ 1 - 0.69834 ≈ 0.30166

So, the probability of at least one hurricane occurring in the next 5 years is approximately 0.30166 or 30.166%.
